title: Expelled Nashville lawmaker returned to Tennessee legislature
description: The Metro Nashville Council has voted unanimously to reappoint Justin Jones, 27, to his seat in the state legislature.

title: US formally deems WSJ reporter ‘wrongfully detained’ in Russia
description: Washington renews call for the immediate release of Evan Gershkovich, who is being held by Moscow on spying charges.

title: ‘We don’t know’: US says still investigating intel document leak
description: White House national security spokesman says it remains unknown if document leak has been contained as probe continues.

title: Biden admin seeks to halt ruling suspending sale of abortion pill
description: The abortion pill mifepristone accounts for more than half of all abortions in the US and is considered safe to use.

title: Muslim leader raises alarm after ‘hate incident’ at Canada mosque
description: Muslims in Canada 'have reasons to feel afraid', local leader says, after man charged in incident near Ontario mosque.

title: Could talks in Yemen end years of war?
description: Optimism is running high about reaching a peace agreement between Yemen’s warring rivals.

title: AI-generated news presenter appears in Kuwait
description: 'Fedha' appeared on the Twitter account of the Kuwait News, with plans for it to read online bulletins.

title: Aid group says two workers shot dead in Ethiopia’s Amhara region
description: Catholic Relief Services workers were killed amid unrest due to government decision to disband regional security forces.

title: Ukraine, Russia exchange more than 200 troops in prisoner swap
description: Such exchanges represent one of the few areas of cooperation between Ukraine and Russia.

title: Guatemala elections: Campaigning begins amid public distrust
description: Some are questioning the vote’s integrity after several opposition candidates were blocked from running.

title: China criticises Indian minister’s visit to Arunachal Pradesh
description: Minister Amit Shah says all Indians can sleep peacefully in their homes thanks to the hard work of the security forces.

title: Americans, beware what belies the smile of Ron DeSantis
description: I met the Florida governor years ago, at Guantanamo.

title: Bread, body: UAE artist Moza Almatrooshi explores food and soul
description: Her performance explores how bakers move within the kitchen, gestures she turned into shapes and baked into bread.

title: At least five dead in shooting in Louisville, Kentucky: police
description: Authorities say the suspected shooter was found dead and six people were injured, including officer.

title: Boat carrying 400 migrants adrift between Italy and Malta
description: People onboard say boat has been adrift for two days as it has taken on water and is without a captain.

title: Israeli violence is the problem
description: Once again Israeli violence rages in occupied Palestine and once again Israel and its allies are trying to obfuscate it.

title: Linesman stood down after apparent elbow on Andy Robertson
description: FA to launch an investigation into a clash between assistant referee Constantine Hatzidakis and the Liverpool full-back.

title: Pakistan is making a mistake in ignoring the US for China
description: Pakistan has long juggled ties with China and the US successfully. It's open turn towards Beijing risks ending that.

title: Deadly blast hits police vehicle in Pakistan’s Quetta: Official
description: Six other injured in the bombing in the southwestern Pakistani province of Balochistan, police said.

title: Dalai Lama apologises after video asking boy to ‘suck my tongue’
description: A statement on Dalai Lama's Twitter account says leader often teases people he meets 'in an innocent and playful way'.

title: Philippines won’t allow US to use bases for ‘offensive actions’
description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr says military bases accessible to the US would not be used in any 'offensive action'.

title: Why is South Africa not renewing 160,000 Zimbabwean work permits?
description: On Tuesday, a South African court will decide if thousands of Zimbabweans can stay back in the country or be deported.

title: Where does Pakistan find itself year after Imran Khan lost power?
description: Ex-PM's message of resistance, victimhood has caught people's imaginations, revealed deep schisms in state institutions.

title: Rinku’s world: Little-known batter’s five sixes stun cricket fans
description: Rinku Singh hits five consecutive sixes to win an IPL match for Kolkata Knight Riders and shoot to instant stardom.

title: Israel signs $400m deal to sell anti-tank missiles to Greece
description: Israel announces the deal days after newly-inducted NATO member Finland bought its missile defence system.

title: Ukraine’s deputy foreign minister visits India
description: Visit by Ukrainian minister comes as India maintains close ties with Russia and refuses to condemn its invasion.

title: China jails two human rights lawyers for ‘subversion’
description: Human rights lawyers Xu Zhiyong and Ding Jiaxi are sentenced to more than 10-year jail after a closed-door trial.

title: Israeli army kills Palestinian, settlers march to illegal outpost
description: Settlers, politicians march to Nablus demanding that the outpost be legalised, Israeli army shoots a teen in Jericho.

title: Two bodies recovered from rubble of collapsed buildings in France
description: At least six people are believed to be missing after an explosion destroys two residential buildings in Marseille.

title: As India’s population soars, number of women in workforce shrinks
description: As India is on cusp of surpassing China to become world's most populous, an estimated 670 million women are left behind.

title: India town mourns burning of historic library at Muslim school
description: Bihar Sharif residents yet to come to terms with burning of century-old 'madrassa' during Hindu festival of Ram Navami.

title: Kuwait’s new government revealed, the seventh in three years
description: Turmoil between Kuwait’s parliament and executive has stalled much-need investments and reforms.

title: Israeli attacks on Syria in the past year: Timeline
description: In the past year alone, Israeli attacks on Syria have killed at least 44 people and injured more than 50.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 411
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 411th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: China staging live-fire drills around Taiwan for third day
description: Beijing's show of force comes in response to Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's recent visit to the United States.

title: US scrambles to find source of leak of Ukraine war intel
description: US Department of Justice launches probe into the possible leak of intel related to Ukraine, China and the Middle East.

title: Zelenskyy condemns Russian strikes on Orthodox Palm Sunday
description: Ukrainian president labels Russia 'terrorist state' in address decrying attacks coinciding with Easter celebrations.
